name: Crowne Plaza Lord Beaverbrook Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stopped here for a night using Crowne Plaza reward points. Staff at the front desk were friendly and helpful as they should be. Our room was clean, comfortable and quiet even thought we were on the street side. The bathroom was on the small size and the A/C was a bit loud and blew up inside the drapes and not right into the room. Do note that: They charge for parking on during the week but not on weekends.
reviews.title: Nothing Special
Beware of the fine print!
reviews.text: We had our breakfast in the hotel restaurant and the service was friendly and efficient. They offer a very reasonably priced excellent breakfast buffet. For a one night stop between Quebec City and Cavendish, PEI this suited our needs very well. We did think Fredericton was a nice little city and the night we were there, there was a bagpipe concert in the town square a couple of blocks from the hotel. Also, there is a nice walk behind the hotel along the river.

I haven't stayed at this hotel yet (booked later in July), and will revise my review after I have, HOWEVER, I wanted people to know about this up front. I just booked a room with 2 queen beds for my husband and myself. I chose the "Book Early and Save" rate which is an advance payment, no refund rate so we could save a little money. When I got the confirmation, we were charged close to $10 more. I chatted with an agent who informed me that the rates are SINGLE OCCUPANCY and you have to pay an extra charge for anyone else in the room STARTING WITH THE SECOND ADULT. Sure enough, it says that on the rate page, but I didn't catch it. Be warned.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right downtown Fredericton, were here withe the family for one night, walking distance from all attractions and restaurant, beautiful cycle path along the St-John river right in front of the hotel. Spacious room and beds were very comfortable, we enjoyed the indoor pool. My daughter was empressed by the lobby, she said it like she was entering a castle. By the way, the beaverbrook gallery is right beside the hotel and you will see a Dali painting there! Couteous staff, the hotel parking is free on the weekend, we had a great stay!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was great, rooms were clean and location was perfect. Again we were greated by warm and friendly front desk staff. The room was comfortable and food in the restaurant was amazing. We would definatly go back!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were treated very well by the staff. The room was spotless.View was spectacular.Brunch was awesome. The location of the hotel was most definately the best in Fredericton . We were on the water and walking trails which are right there ,doesn,t get any better than that..surrounded by the best Fredericton has to offer.. We will always stay there on our trips to the area.
reviews.title: customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza Lord Beaverbrook from May. 25th-May. 27th and it was an excellent experience all around. We had initially booked the Comfort Inn but left within the first 5 minutes due largely to poor hygiene standards and an uncomfortable atmosphere. In a quick audible we decided to look elsewhere and came across the Crowne Plaza. I cannot begin to describe how satisfied we were with the switch. From the moment we walked in we felt comfortable and the staff were absolutely excellent as well as welcoming.
reviews.title: Outstanding

reviews.text: The room was very nice with a large king sized bed and a waterview(a free upgrade from the staff member checking us in. It really started our stay off on the best of notes). The room also had a very nice bathroom and even a Keurig machine for coffee which was a nice touch. I was also very impressed with how seriously this hotel considers peace and quiet to be of major importance. Signs were posted with courtesy guidelines in keeping noise to a minimum and as a result we didn't hear a thing which is a big plus for the light sleepers such as myself. Ample free parking and fast wifi were also much appreciated. The hotel is also located close to many restaurants that were within easy walking distance. I also will mention that the Crowne Plaza is located right on the water and there is an excellent boardwalk right behind it if you feel like taking a walk or going for a run. Initially we expected a much more expensive rate for such a dramatic upgrade, but were pleasantly surprised at how resonable the rates actually were.
reviews.title: Adequate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Crowne Plaza Lord Beaverbrook was without a doubt an excellent experience. The hotel itself is well maintained and the staff make you feel at home. In my opinion this is probably one of the best, if not the best, places to stay in Fredericton. Its location is ideal, we will most certainly be back and not hesitate to recommend the Crowne Plaza to anyone who is looking for a great place to stay in Fredericton. Again a big thank you to the staff for making a routine trip a great one!
reviews.title: Just okay.

reviews.text: I'd give the hotel 3-1/2 stars if I could, but not 4. It's clean, comfy and run fairly well but as others have noted it's a bit dated and there's little things wrong with the rooms that you wouldn't expect when paying almost $200 a night.
reviews.title: charming older hotel with great location

reviews.text: Our second stay here, friendly staff,restaurant a bit pricey for the food quality,the "James Joyce pub" cranks out the classic rock, wierd for an "Irish" style pub! Service a bit slow. But many great restaurants and bars within walking distance!!! They now charge you to park your car and the time delay on the pay per view is reminiscent of dubbed Bruce lee movies. I'm not a neat freak, but the conwebs on the ceiling were a little gross. As was the matted hair that floated in the pool for two days.And is it really that hard for housekeeping to put a new roll of TP in the bathroom? Like the downtown location, but we will try the Delta and take the short cab ride downtown next time. An antique that is becoming antiquated.
reviews.title: Tired hotel in a good location

reviews.text: First of all, Fredericton is a great little city. Super restaraunts and pubs, and there aways seemed to be something going in Officers Square. Now for the Crowne Plaza, I'll start with the good. The staff were very friendly and accomodating. I was there on business for a week and had to print out 100+ pages in the business centre and this was no problem. I'll give them a +1 for the hotel staff. The gym and pool areas were pretty good, all of the equipment was servicable and they had a good selection of free weights. The restaurant, which I only had breakfast in was pretty good, go for the buffet which is by far the best deal. A word of warning though, the scrambled eggs are powdered and taste like it. They will however let you order eggs any style as part of the buffet.
reviews.title: Meh

reviews.text: Now for the not so good...the rooms were very hot and dry. More than once I woke up in the middle of the night in a sweat and dieing of thirst. They apparently had "air conditioning" but no matter what I did at the thermostat, it changed nothing. The AC was no more than a loud fan that didn't even seem to push the air around. I don't know if this is indicative of every room but when I turned on the tap in the bathroom it leaked water all over the counter.
reviews.title: A nice hotel in downtown Fredericton

reviews.text: It was an OK hotel but I don't know if I would give it the four star rating that it apparently has.
reviews.title: Crowne Plaza Beaverbrook Hotel good choice in downtown Fredericton

reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Crowne Plaza Lord Beaverbrook Hotel while visiting Frederticton. This was my first visit to the city in many years and in the past I have stayed at the Delta. I choose the Crowne Plaze due to its location in the downtown core and I had heard it had been renovated.
reviews.title: A storied hotel in New Brunswick Political History!!!

reviews.text: I stayed here one night on business. Great location, wonderful appointments, very charming. I normally do not eat dinner at the hotel, I made an exception as I hadn't rented a car and it turned out to be the best experience of the trip. Sat on the balconey overlooking the river, great service, wonderful meal, excellent presentation, i can't say enough. Nothing negative, would undoubtedly stay here again.
reviews.title: Impressed

reviews.text: I had a splendid room with three windows! Clean, comfortable bed, fluffy towels, quiet.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff is great and attentive.
reviews.title: Silence floor ? Great !

reviews.text: After a long day ride we had reservations for the Lord Beaverbrook. We came in about 1800 , staff was friendly and helpfull. Parking place just outside the hotel. During check in they told us we've been moved to a room at the 6th floor. No problem , we like to stay as high as possible. We were very happy when we saw a sign just outside the elevator that we arrived on the "quiet floor" . The sign prompted guests to close the room doors quietly , to not run and talk loud in the hallways. And , don't know if it helped , but we had a great , peaceful and silence night !
reviews.title: Basic, clean, convenient

reviews.text: Thank you Lord Beaverbrook ! It made our one night stay one of the best during our Atlantic trip !
reviews.title: Best hotel in Fredericton

description: Greetings from the Crowne Plaza Lord Beaverbrook Hotel in downtown Fredericton, New Brunswick situated on the banks of the majestic St. John River! Our historic hotel has long been known for its unbeatable location, comfortable rooms, top-notch meeting and event services and inspired dining experiences. We look forward to making your stay a memorable one.
